message: I'm excited to offer you this incredible opportunity to purchase a unique product that I think you'll really love. I'm open to negotiations, but I was thinking of starting with a price of $1100000.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate. However, I was thinking of a price more around $900000. I believe that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I have to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you halfway, but I need to get closer to my minimum of $1200000. I'm willing to offer you a price of $1050000.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit far from my target. I'm willing to compromise and meet you at $950000. I think that's a fair price considering the product's value to me.

I'm starting to think we're getting close to a deal, but I still need to get a bit closer to my target. I'm willing to meet you at $1020000, but I think that's as low as I can go. I'm counting on you to make a decision.
I understand your concerns, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $980000. I think that's a fair compromise considering the product's value to me.

I'm starting to think we're getting a bit too close to my minimum, and I'd rather not sell it to you for that low. I'm willing to meet you in the middle of my target, so I'm offering you $1150000. This is my final offer, take it or leave it.
I understand this is your final offer, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $1000000. I think that's a fair compromise considering the product's value to me.

I've already made it clear that $1150000 is my final offer, and I'm not willing to go any lower. You're getting close to the price I'd sell it to John for, and I'm starting to think it's not worth continuing the negotiation. If you're not willing to meet me at $1150000, I'm afraid I'll have to sell it to someone else.
